comments.body: Optional: this test looks ripe for conversion into a table driven test (test pairs of service + expected error count).
Extra credit: Write an "Equals" or Intersect method on util.StringSet...

I thought about suggesting a HasAll(...) method

On Thu, Jul 17, 2014 at 1:46 PM, Daniel Smith notifications@github.com
wrote:

> In pkg/api/validation_test.go:
> 
> > ```
> > }
> > names, errs := validateVolumes(successCase)
> > if len(errs) != 0 {
> >     t.Errorf("expected success: %v", errs)
> > }
> > ```
> > -   if len(names) != 3 || !names.Has("abc") || !names.Has("123") || !names.Has("abc-123") {
> > -   if len(names) != 4 || !names.Has("abc") || !names.Has("123") || !names.Has("abc-123") || !names.Has("empty") {
> 
> Extra credit: Write an "Equals" or Intersect method on util.StringSet...
> 
> ## 
> 
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/kubernetes/pull/452/files#r15082918
> .
Yeah, this'll start to get verbose pretty quickly when more volume specs are added. I'll make a utility in a separate PR.
